info.title: Oncoblocks REST API, draft 0.1
info.description: Draft proposal of an Oncoblocks-like web service built with Spring MVC, with REST API documentation by Swagger.  Note that only dummy data is returned.

operations.notes: Finds cancer type by label.
Gets all cancer types in the database

operations.summary: Finds cancer type by parent ID.
operations.notes: Finds cancer type by parent ID.
Adds a new cancer type.
Updates the specified cancer type.
Finds cancer type by ID.
Deletes the specified cancer type.
Adds a new gene.
Finds gene by gene symbol
Gets all genes in the database
Updates the specified gene.
Deletes the specified gene.

operations.summary: Finds gene by Entrez Gene ID.
operations.notes: Finds gene by Entrez Gene ID.
Gets mutations.
Gets mutation by ID.
Inserts a new sample record into the database and returns it.

operations.summary: Gets all samples with the given study attribute.
operations.notes: Gets all samples in the database with the matching study attribute

operations.summary: Gets all samples with the given cancer type
operations.notes: Gets all samples in the database with the given cancer type primary key ID
Gets all samples in the database

operations.summary: Gets all samples with the given sampleId.
operations.notes: Gets all samples in the database with the given sampleId string name
Gets a sample by its primary key ID
Updates an existing sample record and returns it.
Deletes a sample record from the database, given its primary key ID

operations.summary: Gets all tags with the given label.
operations.notes: Gets all tags in the database with the given label attribute
Gets all tags in the database
Inserts a new tag record into the database and returns it.

operations.summary: Gets all tags associated with the given sample.
operations.notes: Gets all tags in the database linked tothe given sample by the sample primary key ID
Gets a tag record from the database by its primary key ID
Updates an existing tag record referenced by its primary key ID and returns it
Deletes a tag record from the database, given its primary key ID.
